meanings.definition: A small lizard found in the Americas.
meanings.sent1: The anole scurried across the garden wall.
meanings.sent2: I saw an anole basking in the sun on the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The anole thought it was invisible by blending with the leaves.
meanings.sent4: She moved as swiftly as an anole, darting from one task to another.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green color of the anole made it stand out in the grass.

meanings.sent1: He tried to anole his way out of trouble by telling a white lie.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to anole her friends, so she decided to be honest.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to anole the audience into believing he could fly.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could anole anyone into thinking she was happy.
meanings.sent5: The con artist's words were like a web of lies, designed to anole the unsuspecting.
